creator: stoehr_sukachevin@hotmail.com
text:
In using the a recent nightly build (jakarta-tomcat-4.0-20011119.zip), when 
specifying CATALINA_BASE explicitly in a different location as CATALINA_HOME, 
that different location has to have "shared/lib/jasper-*.jar" in it in order 
for JSP files to be compilable by Jasper and therefore run within CATALINA_BASE.

Is this the future requirement when using JSPs of CATALINA_BASE (to copy the 
jasper libs from CATALINA_HOME's shared subdir to CATALINA_BASE's shared 
subdir), or can the jasper libs reside somewhere else, like in "common/lib", as 
a default?

We could indeed consider moving Jasper to common/lib.
Craig: Any comments on this ?
creator: remm@apache.org
stoehr_sukachevin@hotmail.com
text:
Note that for Tomcat 4.0.2 beta 2, "jasper-*.jar" now resides in the "lib" 
subdirectory of CATALINA_HOME, so this might not be an issue any longer 
(i.e., "jasper-*.jar" is not needed to be copied into any subdirectory of 
CATALINA_BASE).

In the HEAD branch, Jasper is now in common/lib, so it doesn't need to be
replicated in all CATALINA_BASE/shared/lib directories.
